For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Donald Rumsfeld wrote that he never authorized waterboarding-- simulated drowning-- but he also called CIA interrogators who used the interrogation technique "patriots, not criminals." The questioning of those in department of defence custody provided information that saved innocent American lives. I make no apology for that, he also wrote. Donald Rumsfeld , 78, served as defence secretary in two separate Republican administrations, becoming both the youngest and oldest man to hold the job.
